title: [Self-Directed] Practical Application Techniques for Non-Invasive Load Monitoring (NILM)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic electrical engineering and machine learning concept understanding
context.additional_context: Cultivation of practical problem-solving skills through NILM case studies specific to Quebec residential environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core principles of NILM and barriers to its residential environment application.
Learners can comparatively analyze statistical characteristics of public NILM datasets.
Learners can implement a load decomposition algorithm combining supervised/unsupervised learning.
Learners can propose integration strategies for smart metering technology and NILM.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
